intro: Otacanthus platychilus var. brachyphyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved otacanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often arranged in a dense, compact pattern. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
